main event: A disc-shaped object was observed by a civilian in Culpeper, Virginia, on 3 June 1949, traveling at an estimated speed of 900-1500 mph and banking at terrific speed into the sun for 5-6 seconds.
interesting points: The observer, a cabinet maker and amateur astronomer, saw the object at an estimated altitude of 1500-2000 feet and described it as silver and shaped like an oyster.
It was estimated to be the size of a 5 or 6 room house and appeared to be made of aluminum.
The object disappeared by fading from view into the sun after exhibiting maneuvers of banking with terrific speed.
No sound, odor, or trail was associated with the object, and it had no visible exhaust or jet openings.
The estimated speed of the object was reported to be between 900-1500 mph, and it had no effect on clouds as there were none in the clear sky.
